## 📊 Benchmark Details

<table>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Name</strong></td><td>
BUG
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Overview</strong></td><td>
A large-scale gender bias dataset of 108K diverse real-world English sentences collected using semi-automatic grammatical pattern matching.
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Data Type</strong></td><td>
text
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Domains</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>Wikipedia</li>
<li>Covid19 research</li>
<li>PubMed abstracts</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Languages</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>English</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Similar Benchmarks</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>WinoGender</li>
<li>WinoBias</li>
<li>GAP</li>
<li>WinoMT</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Resources</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/SLAB-NLP/BUG">GitHub Repository</a></li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
</table>

## 🎯 Purpose and Intended Users

<table>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Goal</strong></td><td>
To evaluate and mitigate gender bias in coreference resolution and machine translation models using a large corpus of real-world sentences.
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Target Audience</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>NLP researchers</li>
<li>Machine learning practitioners</li>
<li>Developers of language models</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Tasks</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>Gender bias evaluation</li>
<li>Benchmarking coreference resolution</li>
<li>Benchmarking machine translation</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Limitations</strong></td><td>
N/A
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Out of Scope Uses</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>Non-gender bias related analyses</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
</table>

## 💾 Data

<table>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Source</strong></td><td>
Based on three diverse domains: Wikipedia, Covid19 research, and PubMed abstracts.
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Size</strong></td><td>
108K sentences
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Format</strong></td><td>
text
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Annotation</strong></td><td>
Each instance is manually verified for quality and marked as stereotypical, anti-stereotypical, or neutral.
</td></tr>
</table>

## 🔬 Methodology

<table>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Methods</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>Lexical-syntactic pattern matching</li>
<li>Semi-automatic sentence collection</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Metrics</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>Accuracy</li>
<li>Population bias (ΔG)</li>
<li>Historical bias (ΔS)</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Calculation</strong></td><td>
Metrics are calculated based on F1 scores comparing gender prediction accuracy.
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Interpretation</strong></td><td>
Higher values of ΔG or ΔS indicate greater gender bias.
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Baseline Results</strong></td><td>
N/A
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Validation</strong></td><td>
Results have been validated with human annotators, achieving an 85% accuracy rate for gender assignment.
</td></tr>
</table>

## ⚠️ Targeted Risks

<table>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Risk Categories</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>Gender bias</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Atlas Risks</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li><strong>Fairness:</strong> Data bias</li>
<li><strong>Societal Impact:</strong> Impact on cultural diversity</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Demographic Analysis</strong></td><td>
N/A
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Potential Harm</strong></td><td>
Models may perpetuate harmful gender stereotypes if bias is not addressed.
</td></tr>
</table>
